subComponents.description:
JMA (2007) and Kawai (2005) ; JMA (2007) is modified as followings : 
  cloud liquid water -> precipitation:　Sundqvist (1978)
  cloud ice -> precipitation: Kawai (2005)
  cloud ice fallout: Kawai (2005)
  evaporation of precipitation: Tiedtke (1993)

JMA, 2007: Outline of the operational numerical weather prediction at the Japan Meteorological Agency. Japan Meteorological Agency, 196 pp.
Kawai, H., 2005: Improvement of a Cloud Ice Fall Scheme in GCM. CAS/JSC WGNE Research Activities in Atmospheric and Oceanic Modelling/WMO, 35, 0411-0412.
Sundqvist, H., 1978: A parameterization scheme for non-convective condensation including prediction of cloud water content. Q. J. R. Meteorol. Soc., 104, 677-690.
Tiedtke, M., 1993: Representation of Clouds in Large-Scale Models. Mon. Wea. Rev., 121, 3040-3061.

Cloud Scheme Attributes / Cloud Overlap : 
     other means  maximum-random for LW, random for SW.

Time Stepping Framework / Scheme Type : semi-implicit semi-Lagrangian
Horizontal Diffusion / Scheme Method : bi-harmonic diffusion

Prognostic Variables : vapour, cloud water (liquid+solid)

- Tracers / SchemeName : vertically conservative semi-Lagrangian scheme 
( Yoshimura (in preparation) , Yoshimura and Matsumura (2003,2005) and Yukimoto et al. (2011) )
- Momentum / Scheme Name: vertically conservative semi-Lagrangian scheme 
- Momentum / Scheme Characteristics : 5th order in horizontal, 3rd order in vertical

values: Total mass, water vapour and cloud water

subComponents.description:
General Attributes / sponge layer : 
   Rayleigh Friction is also used.

values: 1 hour for SW and 3 hours for LW
Hu and Stamnes(1993) for LW, Slingo (1989) for SW

subComponents.description: Hirai et al. 2007; Yukimoto et al. 2011;Yukimoto et al. 2012

values: Above-ground litter pool, below-ground litter pool, intermidiate soil organic matter pool, and slow soil organic matter pool
If the temperature is lower than the freezing point, the phase change occurs.
It depends on the vegetation type(SiB).

properties.description:
ConservationOfProperties / WaterTreatment: 
  This model is AGCM, so the river runoff is removed from the system.
